page.title: 18The New Telephone Exchange
page.content: In June 1985 we visited the telephone exchange on the Graig.First we went to the cable chamber but before we went in Mr Coates checked to see if it was safe by using this little box.When we were inside there were thick black cables,with thousands of smaller wires inside.Air was in these all the time at a certain pressure,so if there was a hole in the pipe,the air inside would push out and no water would be able to get in and damage the wires. This exchange is more modern than the one in Pontypridd.Built in 1973,the wires were put in in 1975.This is not the most modern exchange.The TXK1 Exchange is the most modern.In a week about 2,000,000 calls go through the exchange.Altogether 70 people work there,but only 10 of these maintain the exchange. By Michelle Tuchli of Graig-y-wion
